I've been working with a group for the past 3.5 years and we've been 
using=
 JUnit from the beginning. A while back, as the project grew, 
there were t=
imes when we would break tests (or because we had 
external dependencies th=
at we had to wait and had not yet mocked 
things out), tests would fail for=
 a few days before we could get to 
them. 

This stopped our CI, so we intr=
oduced a helper class, TimeBomb. We'd 
add a call to TimeBomb with a date a=
nd the test would stop failing 
until after the provided date. 

It was an =
active way to remind us go back and fix something in a few 
days.

@Ignore =
has a message. What about adding a date? Ignore until the 
date, after whic=
h the test will fail by throwing a runtime exception?

Is that crazy?

Bret=
t
